definition: to beat down the price/to haggle/to slash one's prices
to kill/to murder/to attack/to weaken or reduce/to smart (dialect)/(used after a verb) extremely

sentences.english: If you take everything into account, we really can't drop costs much further.
sentences.chinese: 如果考虑到各方面因素，我们真的无法再杀价了。

sentences.english: You can also bargain if you are making a large cash purchase.
sentences.chinese: 如果您购买时用大量现金的话您也可以杀价。

sentences.english: You can't beat that for a bargain.
sentences.chinese: 你再杀价也不可能那么便宜。

sentences.english: I am also improving in my bartering skills.
sentences.chinese: 而且我提高了我的杀价技巧。
妈为了一件风衣在杀价。

sentences.english: I managed to cut the shopkeeper down to $100 for the watch.
sentences.chinese: 我跟店主杀价，终于把这手表降到100美元。

sentences.english: In addition, reread tip #2 and make sure you ask them if they’ll take less!
sentences.chinese: 另外，再读一下第2条，确定你有和他们杀价。

sentences.english: Before you buy in the market, ask for a discount.
sentences.chinese: 您在市场买东西前要杀价哦。

sentences.english: I like joining every battle for a haggle.
sentences.chinese: 我喜欢参与杀价买卖露一手。

sentences.english: Liz: I learned to negotiate9 from my mother.
sentences.chinese: 我从我妈妈那里学会了杀价。

sentences.english: I should help you bargain next time.
A: I learned to negotiate from my mother.
sentences.chinese: 我从我妈妈那里学会了杀价。

sentences.english: Bargain hunters are also successfully negotiating discounts at big-name chains.
sentences.chinese: 消费者还能够在名牌连锁店里成功杀价。

sentences.english: Samsung Electro-Mechanics seizes market shares by price slash.
sentences.chinese: 三星电机则依靠大幅度杀价来获得市场。

definition: to bargain/to cut or beat down a price
to make a counteroffer when haggling/to bargain
to bargain/to haggle with a peddler
extortion by taking advantage of sb's weakness
